name: Polygon Recent Comments With Avatar
author: PolyXGO

sections.description:
Display recent comments in the sidebar with user avatar/Gravatar support, styles, information, and an active scrollbar for handling numerous comments.
FAQ
Support and request additional features as needed
sections.installation:
1. Upload the polygon-recent-comments-with-avatar folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the Polygon Recent Comments With Avatar plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Configure the plugin by going to the Widgets section in your WordPress dashboard and selecting “Polygon Recent Comments”.
sections.faq:
How to hide the scrollbar when your comments are displayed?

You can set the “Comment display frame height (in pixels)” to a large value (e.g., 1000) or uncheck “Show scroll?”
sections.changelog:
v1.0.4 (May 25, 2024)

UPDATE
– Customize date and time format. Defaults to system date and time.
– Display verified check for administrator accounts.

CHANGED
– Changed avatar layout selection to be more visual.
– Support asynchronous Gravatar display without affecting website performance when there are many comments.

v1.0.3 (May 25, 2024)

CHANGED
– Adjust the plugin structure for integrating expanded feature versions in the future.

FIXED
– Fix the issue with numeric input fields causing errors when entered as strings.
– Adjust the function for truncating comment content to avoid incorrect word breaks that change the meaning.

v1.0.2 (March 1, 2015)

UPDATED
– Enable or disable scroll.
– Option to include a separator (HTML tags) with inline CSS styling (default is <br/>).

FIXED
– Feedback at https://wordpress.org/support/topic/various-changes.

1.0.1 (February 28, 2015)

UPDATED
– Option to show author link.
– Avatar alignment options: left, right, zigzag left to right, or right to left.

FIXED
– Issue with the “Show date?” property. Thanks to https://profiles.wordpress.org/happyecho

See changelog.txt for older changelog
